TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ScriptBehaviorDescriptor extends System.Web.UI.ScriptComponentDescriptor

Docs.summary: Extends the class to provide a wrapper for defining behaviors that are converted into client script.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string type, string elementID) cil managed

Docs.param: A string representation of the type of the client behavior to describe.
The client ID of the target control.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.exception: or is or an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets the identifier for the current instance.
Docs.value:
The ID or a generated value, depending on the conditions described in the following table.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptComponentDescriptor.ID%2A> property has been set. The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptComponentDescriptor.ID%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptComponentDescriptor.ID%2A> property has not been set. A generated ID that consists of the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor.ElementID%2A> property, followed by a dollar sign ($), followed by the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor.Name%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the attribute of the associated element, as set in the constructor.
Docs.value: The client ID of the target control, as set in the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance string GetScript() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the client script that implements the target control on the page.
Docs.returns: The client script that implements the target control on the page.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current instance.
Docs.value: The name of the current instance, if set; otherwise, a generated name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the Name property has not been set, getting the property will set it to a generated value that consists of the last segment of the `type` argument that is passed to the constructor. For example, if `type` is "System.Object", the Name property defaults to "Object".
